result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kurt R. Kutcher was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
shall be installed on any motor vehicle owned and/or operated by defendant.
Concurrent with:

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.
  Defendant shall successfully attend an OWI Victim Impact Panel within 120 days of conviction.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.
  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.

timeConds.notes:
Shall serve 270 days DCJ w/h&t commencing on/before 6/19/15
Consecutive to: with work release and transfer privileges

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on June 5, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Kurt R. Kutcher in court with attorney Steven Michael Cohen.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 20 days mtns; stc set; bail con't  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:15 am.
8:24. Defendant, Kurt R. Kutcher, in court.  Attorney Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court heard.  Deft does have attorney.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  Restrictions on travel: May not leave State of Wisconsin.

Defendant, Kurt R. Kutcher in court w/o counsel as walk in with jail call, James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State requests $10,000 Cash Bail; Def. heard on bail request; Court questions Def.; Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim 3/26/15 at 1:30pm in Br. 3 & Review 3/4/15 at 8:15am in Br. 2; Court sets $5,000.00 PA BOND with conditions:   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  Restrictions on travel: May not leave State of Wisconsin.
